Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Step 1 Analyze the POWL Model Intended Flow R A E P N C Actual POWL Code loop OperatorPOWL operator Operator LOOP children E P This structure implies E Exit OR P E Anomaly 1 Approve P might trigger a re evaluation or P can be skipped entirely after one E

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: xor OperatorPOWL operator Operator XOR children N skip Anomaly 2 Customer notification is optional Intended flow suggests N is mandatory

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: root StrictPartialOrder nodes R A loop xor C Edges R A A loop loop xor A C Since A C and no xor C C is enabled after A Loop and XOR enabled after A Anomaly Closing claim C can happen immediately after A bypassing E P N

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Step 2 Formulate Hypotheses Loop Anomaly Why would Approval trigger Re evaluation Hypothesis P isnt Approve but Request Info Hypothesis Business rule change allowing iterative negotiation Hypothesis Misconfiguration modeling Rework

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: XOR Anomaly Skippable Notification Hypothesis Cost cutting measure Hypothesis Certain claim types auto close without notification Hypothesis Implementation gap developers thought optional

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Partial Order Anomaly A C edge missing XOR C Hypothesis Quick close feature for duplicates Hypothesis Legacy system issue Hypothesis Modeling error copy paste adding A C

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Step 3 Draft SQL Queries Query 1 Premature Closing Find claims where C timestamp before P or C exists but P missing Query 2 Multiple Approvals Count P per claim greater than 1 Query 3 Skipped Notification Claims with C but no N

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Self Correction Refinement on POWL Semantics root order add edge A C and A loop loop xor no edge xor C Result C executes immediately after A then later evaluated approved notified major anomaly

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Plan Anomaly Analysis Loop Structure implies skipping P or re eval after P Optional Notification XOR N skip Premature Closure A C edge bypassing steps Hypotheses business technical reasons SQL Queries detect premature closure multiple approvals skipped notification
